name: Cinnamon
description: Cinnamon strives to provide a traditional user experience. Cinnamon is a fork of GNOME 3.

name: EDE
description: EDE is a small desktop environment built to be responsive, light in resource usage and to have a familiar look and feel.

name: LXQt
description: LXQt is the Qt port and the upcoming version of LXDE, the Lightweight Desktop Environment. It is the product of the merge between the LXDE-Qt and the Razor-qt projects: A lightweight, modular, blazing-fast and user-friendly desktop environment.

name: MATE
description: Mate provides an intuitive and attractive desktop to Linux users using traditional metaphors. MATE is a fork of GNOME 2.

name: Pantheon
description: Pantheon is the default desktop environment originally created for the elementary OS distribution. It is written from scratch using Vala and the GTK3 toolkit. With regards to usability and appearance, the desktop has some similarities with GNOME Shell and Mac OS X.

name: Unity
description: Unity is a shell for GNOME designed by Canonical for Ubuntu.

name: 9wm
description: 9wm is an X window manager which attempts to emulate the Plan 9 window manager 8-1/2 as far as possible within the constraints imposed by X.

name: awesome
description: awesome is a highly configurable, next generation framework window manager for X. It is very fast, extensible and licensed under the GNU GPLv2 license.

name: Blackbox
description: Blackbox is the fast, lightweight window manager for the X Window System you have been looking for, without all those annoying library dependencies. Blackbox is built with C++ and contains completely original code (even though the graphics implementation is similar to that of WindowMaker).

name: bspwm
description: bspwm is a tiling window manager that represents windows as the leaves of a full binary tree.

name: Compiz
description: OpenGL compositing window manager. It has a plug-in system to be changed at runtime.

name: dwm
description: dwm is a dynamic window manager for X. It manages windows in tiled, monocle and floating layouts. All of the layouts can be applied dynamically, optimising the environment for the application in use and the task performed.

name: Enlightenment
description: Enlightenment is not just a window manager for Linux/X11 and others, but also a whole suite of libraries to help you create beautiful user interfaces with much less work than doing it the old fashioned way and fighting with traditional toolkits, not to mention a traditional window manager.

name: Fluxbox
description: Fluxbox is a windowmanager for X that was based on the Blackbox 0.61.1 code. It is very light on resources and easy to handle but yet full of features to make an easy, and extremely fast, desktop experience. It is built using C++ and licensed under the MIT-License.

name: FVWM
description: FVWM is an extremely powerful ICCCM-compliant multiple virtual desktop window manager for the X  Window system.

name: i3
description: i3 is a tiling window manager, completely written from scratch. The target platforms are GNU/Linux and BSD operating systems, our code is Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) under the BSD license. i3 is primarily targeted at advanced users and developers.

name: IceWM
description: IceWM is a window manager for the X Window System (freedesktop, XFree86). The goal of IceWM is speed, simplicity, and not getting in the user's way.

name: JWM
description: JWM is a light-weight window manager for the X11 Window System. JWM is written in C and uses only Xlib at a minimum. Because of its small footprint, JWM makes a good window manager for older computers and less powerful systems, such as the Raspberry Pi, though it is perfectly capable of running on modern systems.

name: Matchbox
description: Matchbox is an Open Source base environment for the X Window System running on non-desktop embedded platforms such as handhelds, set-top boxes, kiosks and anything else for which screen space, input mechanisms or system resources are limited.

name: Mutter
description: Mutter is a window manager for the X Window System, and is in the process of becoming a Wayland compositor; it became the default window manager in GNOME 3, replacing Metacity.

name: Openbox
description: Openbox is a highly configurable, next generation window manager with extensive standards support.

name: pekwm
description: pekwm is a window manager that once upon a time was based on the aewm++ window manager, but it has evolved enough that it no longer resembles aewm++ at all.

name: ratpoison
description: Ratpoison is a simple Window Manager with no fat library dependencies, no fancy graphics, no window decorations, and no rodent dependence. It is largely modelled after GNU Screen which has done wonders in the virtual terminal market.

name: Sawfish
description: Sawfish is an extensible window manager using a Lisp-based scripting language. Its policy is very minimal compared to most window managers. Its aim is simply to manage windows in the most flexible and attractive manner possible.

name: wmii
description: A small, scriptable window manager, with a 9P filesystem interface and an acme-like layout.

name: xmonad
description: xmonad is a dynamically tiling X11 window manager that is written and configured in Haskell. In a normal WM, you spend half your time aligning and searching for windows. xmonad makes work easier, by automating this.

name: Builder
description: Builder is an IDE for GNOME that is focused on bringing the power of the GNOME platform to more developers than ever before.

name: Evince
description: The most popular document viewer on the GNOME platform.

name: Gedit
description: Gedit is the GNOME text editor. While aiming at simplicity and ease of use, gedit is a powerful general purpose text editor.

name: Polari
description: IRC client built to be easy to use.

name: To Do
description: Minimalistic personal task manager designed to fit right into your GNOME desktop.

name: FeedReader
description: RSS desktop client able to integrate with multiple online services.

name: Vocal
description: Podcast client for the modern desktop.

name: Spice-Up
description: Desktop presentation app

name: NaSC
description: Intelligent calculator app.

name: Dolphin File Manager
description: File manager for KDE focusing on usability.

name: GParted
description: The most popular disk partitioning software out there.

name: Zathura
description: Highly customizable document viewer. It provides a minimalistic and space saving interface as well as an easy usage that mainly focuses on keyboard interaction.

name: Y PPA Manager (Ubuntu)
description: Search for packages in Launchpad PPAs.

name: pirut (Fedora)
description: pirut provides a set of graphical tools for managing software.

name: Synaptics (Debian and .deb users)
description: A graphical package management program for apt. Provides the same features as the apt-get command line utility with a GUI front-end.

name: YaST (openSUSE)
description: The main package management tool on openSUSE.

name: YumEx (Fedora)
description: A GUI for the dnf package manager.

name: Yaourt (Arch)
description: A wrapper for pacman which adds automated access to the AUR using the same syntax as pacman.

name: Aura (Arch)
description: Secure, multilingual package manager.

name: AppImageKit
description: Using AppImageKit you can package applications in the AppImage format that runs on common Linux-based operating systems, such as RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu, Fedora, debian and derivatives; one app = one file.

name: cmus
description: Small, fast and powerful console music player.

name: fuck
description: Command line tool which corrects your previously mistyped command.

name: git
description: Free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

name: glances
description: Cross-platform system monitoring tool.

name: htop
description: Nice looking, customizable task manager.

name: nano
description: Simple to use text editor.

name: photorec
description: Useful tool for restoring deleted files.

name: ranger
description: Vim-inspired file manager for the console.

name: screenFetch
description: Fetches system/theme information in terminal.

name: speed-test
description: Test your Internet connection speed and ping using speedtest.net from the CLI.

name: testdisk
description: A tool for disk partition recovery.

name: tig
description: Text-mode interface for git. It functions mainly as a Git repository browser.

name: vim
description: Advanced text editor that seeks to provide the power of the de-facto Unix editor 'Vi', with a more complete feature set.

name: vtop
description: Easily-extendable activity monitor.

name: wavemon
description: Monitoring application for wireless network devices.
